active_learning.discussion_prompt: In what scenarios would you prefer managed identities over traditional service principals? Discuss the trade-offs in terms of security (e.g., no credential management), manageability (e.g., automatic lifecycle), and development effort (e.g., simpler integration), using examples from Azure Security Benchmark controls like IM-3. Consider real-world breaches involving over-privileged service accounts, such as those in supply chain attacks like SolarWinds.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in university-level pedagogy (Bloom's Taxonomy, active learning, scaffolding). Generate high-quality flashcards for the topic 'Service Principal Management' (Category: Cybersecurity | Domain: Asset Security | Subdomain: Data Security Controls | Entry Domain: Cloud Data Security | Entry Subdomain: Cloud Access Security | Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Asset Security > Data Security Controls > Cloud Data Security > Cloud Access Security > Service Principal Management). **Research Context (Complete Summary):** Service principals are crucial for Azure cloud IAM as non-human identities for apps/services, preventing over-privileged accounts in Zero Trust model (e.g., SolarWinds exploits). Core: Service Principal (directory instance of app), Application Object (global template), Managed Identity (auto-managed SP), Credentials (secrets/certificates). ASB IM-3: Use managed IDs/SPs with restrictions, auto-rotate creds via Key Vault; AM-4: Inventory assets. Steps: az ad app create, az ad sp create, az role assignment create. Integrate: Key Vault, PIM, Sentinel. Sources: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/develop/app-objects-and-service-principals, https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/security/benchmark/azure/security-controls-v3-identity-management, https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/resources/security-benchmark. **Learning Objectives:** [Insert the learning_objectives array here] **Scaffolding Layers:** [Insert the scaffolding_layers array here] **Active Learning Tie-Ins:** Reference discussion/peer teaching/problem-solving in explanations to encourage deeper engagement. **Flashcard Generation Instructions:** - Create 25-35 MCQs per the exact flashcard_schema. - Distribute: Layers 1-4 evenly; Bloom's progressively. - Ensure voter consensus: completeness (full CLI/examples), pedagogy (measurable objs), structure (concept map refs), big picture (Zero Trust/AS B). - Link to prior: Azure AD basics. Output ONLY a JSON array of flashcard objects in the specified format. No additional text.
